website_summaries.verdict: The best product available for people who want to make fresh yogurt on a regular basis.
pros: Cooling unit automatically lowers temperature of finished yogurt, allowing you to "set it and forget it

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't get easier than this. Perfect yogurt every time
customer_reviews.text: I have had this yogurt maker for over 6 months, like everything, i tried different brand of yogurt a starters. I finally settled for "Fage" Greek yogurt and whole milk. It produces beautiful yogurt every single time. I like Greek yogurt so I pour the resulting content in a drainer for about 12 hours, I get a thick yogurt that very similar to the yogurt you get in Greece (no additives for thickness). I reuse about 6-7 ounces of the drained yogurt to start the next batch. I love how easy it is, pretty much add your starter yogurt, add whole milk, set the yogurt maker for 12 hours, press "start"... come back in 12 hours and enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great way to make yogurt until the heating element failed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Cuisinart in December 2017. I used it approx 2x per month, perhaps 10-12 times in total. It made outstanding yogurt (until it didn't.) It appears the heating element failed. I am attempting to reach customer service. We will see if they are willing to resolve the issue. Update- I reached Cuisinart customer service. They were very helpful and said they are sending out a replacement. They ask that I put the old one in the box and include a $10 money order or check. We will see how the replacement goes, but I am encouraged. I will change the rating if the machine comes in and works.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how this works for so many people.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all. We tried several batches of 24 hour yogurt (for SCD). None of the came out as they should have. We also tried to manually warm up the milk to 110 and then drop it in here - no luck. The only time it worked was when we only filled it up halfway. Whats the point of that? This has led me to question the reviews I read on amazon before purchasing an item.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Delicious yogurt every time
customer_reviews.text: It's great to be able to make yogurt without having to heat the milk to an exact temperature and then watch the clock while fermenting. A pricy convenience, but I wouldn't be making so much yogurt otherwise. I strain the yogurt to make it thicker (Greek yogurt) and then use some of the whey that is drained off as starter for the next batch. My only complaint is that I wish it made more than a quart at a time. Not enough for a household that eats a lot of yogurt!
customer_reviews.author: Lynne T

customer_reviews.title: Cooling system stops working after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Product worked very well for several months, then the cooling system stopped working. Cuisinart replaced it under warranty with a new unit, which failed even sooner (same problem). A better way to make yogurt is to heat milk in a microwave, allow it to cool to 110F, mix it with 4 oz. yogurt, and pour the mixture into a 36 oz. Yeti bottle, which will keep it warm enough to incubate. After 8 hours, empty into another container and refrigerate. Makes better yogurt than the Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Dupen

customer_reviews.title: Good for a short period of time only
customer_reviews.text: Bought a first one in January 2017 and loved it, until it stopped working. The first time it does not work, you are not sure what went wrong and do not anticipate that it is the yogurt maker that is no longer working, and you waste at least another batch... bought a second machine in April 2018, which gave up again recently. I would not recommend this yogurt maker to anyone. The heating component does not seem to last.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Pierre Isbendjian

customer_reviews.title: The warrenty means nothing once it past the 30 days and broke.
customer_reviews.text: After only 6 month I got up one morning and the machine did no longer work. Amazon got in touch with the manufacturer who told me to bad no exchange or refund since it was 6 month old, Thank god for amazon who refunded my account ,don't you just love amazon . As long as it works the yogurt is easy to make and tastes great, a shame so many people are having trouble with this machine. Manufactured in CHINA ,stop the import.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Second One to Break. Poor Customer Service.
customer_reviews.text: The first one was fine - I wasn't thrilled that using previous batches of yogurt as starter didn't seem to work all that well, so I just bought a container of yogurt from the store and use a bit of that as my starter. Then it stopped working. It was still covered under warranty but I had to pay a small fee. Then the replacement they sent me quit too. I emailed customer service, who said they would get back to me within 24-48 hours. Three weeks later, I sent a followup email asking if they had reviewed my request yet. Still no response. I wouldn't use this product again and will think twice about purchasing anything more from Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Know what your getting into
customer_reviews.text: Misleading. You do need to heat to 180 then cool to 100. Instructions were confusing. Was going to send it back, but tried it and the yogurt was so good I kept it. I think the constant heat and cooling makes the diff. Prep wasn’t too bad. Update. Love this thing. I just crank the stove and constantly whisk about 5 min and bam. It’s to temp. Then I let it sit about 5 min and then set on ice pack to bring it down. Then into machine no matter what time of day. Takes about 15 min total prep. Which is good. I use this every other day.
customer_reviews.author: AnnO

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: This yogurt maker is a disappointment for me. I had read the reviews and found many reviewers pleased with the machine. I have made several batches with it. None tasted good (some better than others) and all were somewhat runny (some more than others). It's a good idea, but I think I'll continue purchasing large quantities of yogurt at our health food store. It would certainly be more economical to make at home, but not if I'm going to continue pouring it down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty shopper

customer_reviews.title: When it works is great...
customer_reviews.text: It stops to work after few months. I checked on the replacement policy and discovered that you have to pay ~$25 plus the deliveries cost! I decided to repair by myself and with "DAOKI 2PCS TEC1-12706 12V 60W Heatsink Thermoelectric Cooler Cooling Peltier Plate Module 12V 6A" that cost a fraction of the total requested by Cuisinart, I did the job and I have even a spare Peltier cell!
customer_reviews.author: P. Giorgio

customer_reviews.title: Just get a sous vide
customer_reviews.text: A nice appliance, but for the price get a sous vide precision cooker and make yogurt in 1/2 gallon glass jars. This cuisinart maker does not make very much yogurt. The refrigeration function is nice but really not necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. I tried using it 8 times in multiple ways. I couldn't get anything to work. It always produced a ball of yogurt in the middle with soup surrounding it. I'm returning it! Waste of money and effort.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B. Landolt

customer_reviews.title: Fresh yogurt with no preservatives!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this yogurt maker for a couple of years. I love the yogurt that comes from it. I use a Greek yogurt start (1/4 cup) and whipping cream (quart). It processes for 9 hours. It’s full fat and not the best way to go health wise, but it’s wonderful with fresh fruit or added to a smoothy. I’m trying to find a lower fat recipe but until I do- Yum!! The maker is very easy: put ingredients in, set the timer and leave it. It automatically cools the yogurt if you leave it in past the process time. And it’s digital read-out is clear. It cleans up very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Burtnett

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great feature that once the preset fermenting time has been reached, it goes into cool down mode.
customer_reviews.text: I suppose this yogurt maker is one of the better ones on the market. It’s a great feature that once the preset fermenting time has been reached, it goes into cool down mode. Unfortunately, I haven’t gotten a single palatable batch of yogurt out of the thing. In fairness, it’s probably not the fault of the appliance - it does what it’s made to do - incubate for a set time, then cool down. I have been trying to create non-dairy yogurt from coconut or almond milk which I have had zero success with. I’m sorry I bought it as it’s a pretty pricey gadget when you don’t get results.
customer_reviews.author: Pinky

customer_reviews.title: Homemade yogurt is a game changer!
customer_reviews.text: I love this yogurt maker! It is extremely easy to use and consistently makes the most delicious and creamy yogurt every time... seriously, the taste of the yogurt is so much better than any store bought brand, I will never go back. Both the set up and clean up are a breeze. I am so happy with this little machine, if you eat yogurt daily, it makes a week's worth of the most incredible yogurt in one batch!
customer_reviews.author: Laura P

customer_reviews.title: Really great results, easy to use, but display too simple
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the recommendation of a friend, and I am equally pleased. It works really well. Its easy to clean. And the results are great. My only complaint is that the display is very simplistic. So you can set it for a number of hours (up to 24), but then you need to have it stay in cooling mode at least 12 hours after the warming cycle is complete. But there is no timer for that at all - just a "C". So you have to watch the clock.
customer_reviews.author: Beach Books and Music

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long enough
customer_reviews.text: Loved this yogurt maker until it stopped working. I bought it almost 3 years ago and used it every week since. The only problem is that it stopped working about a week ago. We contacted Cuisinart via email and phone (never got through to talk to a real person, however) but there's been no response. It does have a limited 3 year warranty but we have to pay shipping and enclose $10 with the unit before they'll look at it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: consistent results
customer_reviews.text: Only minor dislike is small capacity. But it handles a quart of milk which is practical and makes sense. My recipe is a Bulgarian culture with 24 hours heating and then 24 hours of cooling. This last part is where a refrigerator does not work as well. The cooling cycle gives a great quality. But being able to just turn it on and come back in 48 hours for a consistently great result makes this great. Any recipe can be modified for far less time. Each recipe differs with content of fat, sugar, quantity and quality of culture, and time of incubation.
customer_reviews.author: DrBlack

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: How is it I can still be using a steam iron my mother got in the 1950s but this thing fails in less than a year? OK, after mastering the persnickety little tricks to getting yogurt out of it I was pretty happy with the product, but after 8 months of use the heating element failed and all I get now is vaguely yogurt flavored soup. Damned annoying waste of 80 bucks, and I hate putting this huge thing in a landfill, but there ya go. Warranty terms are ridiculous so I'm done here. Trying making yogurt in a ceramic pot in the oven on the bread proofing setting. Bet it works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: D. Witte

customer_reviews.title: Great EXCEPT broke just after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Easy to make consistent yogurt. I do scale the milk beforehand for better texture, as recommend. With the automatic refrigeration, I don't have to plan ahead for when to transfer the yogurt tub from yogurt maker to fridge. Love it except the stopped working after 3 years (no longer heated), just after the warranty expired. Buying another since I can't find any better alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I have had this product for one month and I've ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for one month and I've attempted to make yogurt 6 times. Each time I followed the store bought yogurt recipe, I added one more hour to the recipe and my yogurt still came out runny. I'm not too thrilled with this product, but I will keep trying. I'm going to try to add a thickening agent to see if that will help. If anyone has any luck with thickening agent, please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Buster & Ozzie

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Super Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I have made a few batches of Greek Yogurt already and it was fantastic. I did not do anything on the stovetop and only followed the directions in the manual. I used 6oz of Chobani as a starter & 4 cups of whole milk whisked together. I start it before bed and when I get home from work the next day, I put it in the strainer and voila. Super easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: So happy I chose this one...
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, BUT this is fabulous. I love not needing to be home when it transfers from warm to cold, and if I work late that is a big plus. My favorite starter is FAGE Total all natural greek strained yogurt. It has a natural sweetness with only 2 ingredients - milk and cream. It makes the smoothest, creamiest end product after I let it drip thru coffee filters in the fridge overnight. The toddlers love it so much with a drizzle of honey or maple syrup. I use the liquid whey left over in my smoothies to add extra protein, so it is not wasted. love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and clean, works great. My biggest objection to making my own yogurt was having to time it so the yogurt finished when I was going to be at home or simply awake ! But with this Cuisinart I can get the yogurt going when it is convenient and then just pop it in the refrigerator when it's done. Great idea and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jean B

customer_reviews.title: Best yogurt machine ever
customer_reviews.text: Best yogurt machine ever, super easy to use. Perfect yogurt every single time. We use Noosa original culture and this yogurt machine made perfect yogurt, consistent, smooth and creamy. Couldn't ask for more. To save time and energy, we usually let it run for 8-9 hours, and then just turn the machine off during cool down stage and move the yogurt into the fridge to continue the cool down process there. Much more efficient that way.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAholic

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until it broke.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this yogurt maker July 18, 2018. so it lasted about 10 months. I love the machine, it makes wonderful , consistent yogurt and the chill feature is such a great bonus. However about two months ago is stopped coming on when I would plug it in and I would have to tap it on the counter to get it to come on. This week it finally bit the dust. After reading all the reviews about the return policy, I'm not going to bother and for now will be trying the Luvele Plus and hope that it holds up better.
customer_reviews.author: Sheree Pecoraro

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine
customer_reviews.text: Great machine - works well. Love that it chills the product when done so you can set it and forget it. Be aware, you do need to prep the milk first by heating it to scalding temp then cooling it slightly before mixing the starter so there’s a little prep involved - not just a dump and press start sort of thing. I prefer to strain the yogurt after it’s finished to remove the whey, then whip it with a mixer for the silkiest, thick yogurt ever. I’ll never eat store yogurt again. Wish the container was larger - after straining, the 1.5l capacity renders about 2.5 cups.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Hanks

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this!!! It makes delicious yogurt. The first batch I made using a starter culture was "meh" but the second, third, fourth and fifth batch were all so amazing. I just recommend saving the portion you need and not accidentally eating it! Only downside is I wish it was twice as big because I do strain the yogurt to make a thick Greek yogurt...
customer_reviews.author: Michele Carroll

customer_reviews.title: ... started buying homemade yogurt at a farmers market and liked it so much that I finally decided that I ...
customer_reviews.text: I started buying homemade yogurt at a farmers market and liked it so much that I finally decided that I should make my own. I bought this Cuisinart after talking to a friend who has one. It works beautifully and makes one pint plus about one serving of thick, not too tangy, yogurt. Very easy to use. If you want to make a whole lot of yogurt at once you probably should consider an instant pot (sp?).
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Great Yogurt maker
customer_reviews.text: It is too bad that they are no longer making them. I love that you can time how long it is kept warm so the yogurt can be kept from becoming too tart. And, you don't have to be there when it is done as it is kept cold for you!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy A

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this 2 months ago, and it has been in use almost daily since. Simply put, it has been flawless, and the auto-cooling cycle means I don't have to time the yogurt cycle to my life, but rather, it can wait for me. I don't do anything fancy to get there from here. I add culture, I add milk, a little honey, some vanilla, and set it on a 12 hour cycle, and Bob's your uncle! No heating on the stove, no dirty pots, bowls or spoons. Just pour your goodies in, stir it up a bit, and push the start button!
customer_reviews.author: wk4bg8s

customer_reviews.title: Three cheers.
customer_reviews.text: If your into making small batches of yogurt this is great, easy to use and clean. I like it because of the chill cycle after the fermentation period has finished. The only thing I wish is it would make a large batch. Also if your going to buy get the extended warranty.......jost in case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is an excellent machine, but the key problem is that it ...
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent machine, but the key problem is that it heats and makes yogurt in a plastic container. I wish it can sell separately to those of us who are health conscious a steel or glass container for yogurt making. Without the steel or glass container, this machine has no use for me, and I returned it. But I will love to buy it again if they can separately sell a steel or glass container for yogurt making.
customer_reviews.author: Hari R Garhwal

customer_reviews.title: Great yogurt maker!
customer_reviews.text: Returned an instant pot for this yogurt maker. Makes terrific yogurt, and goes into chill mode when done. Very easy to use, and doesn’t take up a lot of room. Seller was very quick to deliver. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Ss

customer_reviews.title: It stops working after 3-4 months!
customer_reviews.text: The same thing happened to us as other reviewers pointed out: the machine stopped working after only four months. We used it maybe a dozen times and the heating element just gave out. Since we didn't buy the extended warranty, we're left with a defunct machine and no intention of buying another product from this company. Another small electronic to add to a landfill somewhere, when our intention was to make our own yogurt so we could stop buying plastic containers!
customer_reviews.author: T.A. Repak

customer_reviews.title: Plan on it breaking within a year.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in Dec 2016. Loved it! Until the heating portion quit in May (?) 2017. Got a replacement ... worked until about 3 weeks ago (early Jan 2018) -- cooling quit this time. Really love the design and function of this machine. Just wish it was reliable. I realize this is a complicated machine with both heating and cooling. Knew before we entered into the purchase people had problems with this setup. FYI - we used it about 3-4 times a week
customer_reviews.author: David Primm

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in July, and now, in October, it's broken. Cuisinart is charging me $10 to send out a replacement, plus I have to pay to return the cord of the original. What a poorly made product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it stopped cooling during cold/cool cycle
customer_reviews.text: Purchased CYM in July 2017. Worked great until it stopped cooling during cold/cool cycle. Calling Cuisinart tomorrow to see if they will stand behind their 3 year warranty. You pay this much for a premium product you expect it to last for years. (Update Feb 2018). Cuisinart customer service was great with replacing my maker with a new one. Unfortunately today my second one stopped heating. I give up! I would not recommend purchasing this product. Great when it worked but product should last much longer than a few months. I am going the “crockpot method” from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: CBHNC

customer_reviews.title: Will not last!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine even after reading the reviews that it would break quickly. The machine was great and then stopped working. Cuisinart’s customer service is one of the worst I have ever experienced. It took over a month and countless emails to final get them to agree to honor their warranty only to be told they have discontinued the machine and I could only get a credit with them. Do not make the same mistake I did! Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Craig

customer_reviews.title: Missing Power Cord
customer_reviews.text: Arrived missing the power cord. I returned it. When I tried to buy it again, it was no longer available. Nor was there an option to contact the seller to provide a replacement cord. Apparently Cuisinart no longer makes any model of yougurt making machine.
customer_reviews.author: Famman49

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product one year ago. Within six months it stopped working. Called their 800 customer service number. No problem! Cuisnart will replace it for a nominal fee, plus the postage I paid to return it. Within a short time, I received a "new" yogurt maker, which now I suspect was a refurbished machine. Now, six months later, the second machine has stopped chilling! Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Rita Cuthbertson

customer_reviews.title: One thing I like about this unit is that it will begin cooling ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish this yogurt maker had a larger capacity, but it works very well for the purpose I need it--to make 24 hour lactose free yogurt. I strain the yogurt, which is very acidic after 24 hours, and add lactose free milk back to the yogurt to get the consistency I need. One thing I like about this unit is that it will begin cooling the yogurt at the end of the cycle, so I don't have to run home to put it in the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Finger

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe I've spent so much time without this machine!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I've made yogurt...with spotty results...by hand. I've made yogurt....with spotty results....with the use of two other electrical "yogurt makers". But this is the real deal. After you have heated your milk and added your yeast and anything else you may be adding, just pour it in, set the time and walk away. It does the rest. Really. Even the cool down. And then it waits for you and keeps the yogurt perfectly. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Good yoghurt but maybe too much work
customer_reviews.text: I liked the thought of making our own yoghurt. Think it was kind of a lot of work for not that much yoghurt. Would like and easier way to heat up the milk b4. The machine stopped working within 2 months?! Got money back without questions though. But afraid to try again.
customer_reviews.author: Freddy74

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in July 2016 and by November 2016, the timer failed. I noticed it the last time I made yogurt and restarted the timer and it began to work. This time, nothing will make it count down the time. I am very unhappy. Until this happened, I was very happy with the product and used it once or twice a week.
customer_reviews.author: Terry A Allbright

customer_reviews.title: Great yoghurt maker - just experiment to get thickness you want
customer_reviews.text: The yoghurt maker is well designed, well built and easy to use. The variability of milk means that it is not a simple matter to set and forget to get the consistency you want. There is an indication in the focus in the hints in the manual - they are all about how to get a thicker constency. I have found with our goats milk that adding a cup of milk powder and setting the fermentation time to 10 hours produces a wonderfullly thick yoghurt. Once this is sorted, it is truly a breeze to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Peter Phillips

customer_reviews.title: CYM 100 Cuisinart Electronic yogurt maker
customer_reviews.text: I love it, Easy to use Made my First Yogurt using Organic store yogurt as my starter, This is a real review , If you're looking to make yogurt easy ,I highly recommend Cuisinart electronic CYM100 yogurt maker.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia  Garner

customer_reviews.title: Great until it quit working
customer_reviews.text: I loved this yogurt maker. It couldn't have been easier to get consistent excellent results. After slightly more than a year, the cooling function stopped working and I had to throw out that batch of yogurt. Contacted Cuisinart who will replace it and pay for shipping. Will probably get another one and hope it lasts longer than a year. Can't go back to store bought now.
customer_reviews.author: sheeps234

customer_reviews.title: Could not be easier to use
customer_reviews.text: This yogurt maker is fantastic, very easy to use - could not be easier! Cleanup does not take any time and it even looks great on the kitchen counter top. Yogurt tastes wonderful and much better than any commercially available yogurt. From now on we will never buy yogurt again.
customer_reviews.author: Md11skipper

customer_reviews.title: QUIT HEATING AFTER TWO YEARS
customer_reviews.text: Made great yogurt. I used a blob of store bought as a starter, 1/3 C of powdered milk, and filled the rest of the container with regular whole milk. Then strained the result in a strainer. Was wonderful. But it just stopped heating after two years. Now useless. Expensive purchase for two years. After reading the other reviews about trying to get it fixed or returned, I didn't bother. Will not buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is the best product because you don't have to heat the milk
customer_reviews.text: Oh, this is the best product because you don't have to heat the milk! Just mix up the milk, yogurt starter (and I add some dry milk because I use Fat Free Milk) and pour in and start. Once the heat process has ended, this product then cools your yogurt. Love this Electronic Yogurt Maker! Efficient and fast service from vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Linda de los Santos

customer_reviews.title: Tastes like cheesecake
customer_reviews.text: First- I despise yogurt. A coworker convinced me to try her homemade yogurt from this machine and I was hooked. Ordered this machine and have been making yogurt several times each week for months since buying. I heat milk to 180 and cool to 110. Add 1 packet of yogourmet cultures once cool and add to maker. Set time to 10 hours. I prefer to strain the yogurt so it is thicker but it tastes great straight from the machine. This is a game changer! I just wish it made a bit more yogurt at a time!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: I like Greek yogurt and my husband like yogurt smoothies
customer_reviews.text: We use this all the time. I like Greek yogurt and my husband like yogurt smoothies, and this machine helps with both. We do not have to worry about timing, as the machine does that. This machine does not do all of the steps for Greek yogurt, but it does the most time-consuming. I eat yogurt A LOT, and this machine has helped us make yogurt that is healthier and cheaper than store bought.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Christine Delea

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this machine
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this machine!! I make yogurt 3-4 times a week since we purchased this and it turns out great every time. I use 4 cups of Vit D milk and a tablespoon of my previous made yogurt and I let it ferment for 9 hours. I don't heat the milk and I don't add anything more. I do however use a yogurt strainer when it's cooled after 12 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to use. I can and have made yogurt every day without any problems. Use the booklet that comes with the product and you will have no problems! I love this thing! I even use lactose free milk to make yummy greek yogurt! I'm so happy I purchased this product! I mix everything up when I get home from work and when I wake up in the morning, I have fresh cold yogurt to bring to work!
customer_reviews.author: MD ain't bad

customer_reviews.title: Platic Tub Cracked After About 4 Uses - no reason
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, then the plastic tub cracked for no reason., I mean, it's high temp plastic! Now I have to fuss with the warranty or buy a new tub. I did slip a 1 qt baggie in there as a liner and it still works. I just pull out the baggie full of yogurt. But really, it says right on the tub it's good to 230 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: Works great and don't have to rush home to put in ...
customer_reviews.text: I just bring the milk to 110 (3.3 minutes in microwave in glass measuring cup). Works great and don't have to rush home to put in fridge. Updated 6-18-18 The cooling feature went out within 6 months. They replaced it and I paid ten dollars shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Abysmal
customer_reviews.text: How do I return this item? Useless product, not only is the texture awful, its like drinking watered down milk. No consistency to the yogurt. I am extremely upset, I have been waiting for a good yogurt maker due to my health condition and when I finally order one it doesn't even work. Good thing I bought insurance for this poorly designed machine.
customer_reviews.author: Asael

customer_reviews.title: Did not make yogurt! :(
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this yogurt maker for my parents for Christmas. They have not been able to get it to make yogurt despite numerous attempts with different ingredients, different settings, etc. The end result was either very watery, stringy or tasted very bad. I choose this maker based on product reviews and the convenience of the cool cycle that I thought would be handy for my parents. Very disappointed it does not work. Fortunately, Amazon has excellent customer service and is letting me return it even though it is past the return date. I have the Euro Cuisine maker and it works great. I will place an order for one of these to replace the Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: BBunch

customer_reviews.title: I love making my own yogurt!
customer_reviews.text: After a bit of trial and error I finally made yogurt!! The kind I like is almost $5 a couple container. I make it for less than $2 and I know exactly what’s in it. This machine makes it easy. I just put the ingredients in and it does the work!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: Worst yogurt maker ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst yogurt maker ever. Instructions give you no idea how long to ferment any of their recipes - tells you to try different times until you find one that works. I've wasted plenty of starter and milk and only got one good batch out of about 15 tries. Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Sinkus

customer_reviews.title: didn't heat to even 100*F
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't even heat to 100*F--did two water trials to check temperature after a failed attempt at making yogurt. Due to the high percent of bad reviews about this very issue, I am returning the product with no exchange. Very disappointed in Cuisinart. This machine tops several lists for "best yogurt makers" but, clearly it shouldn't.
customer_reviews.author: brorob

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This works great. It's easy to understand and easy to use. So far it is used about 4 days a week and performs flawlessly every time.
customer_reviews.author: Karissima

customer_reviews.title: Set it and Forget it!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome machine. We've made some great Almond Milk yogurt and Soy Milk yogurt. Once you figure it out, there is just a little cooking of your ingredients, then you pour it all in, set the time and forget about it! It will automatically keep it cold a day or two until you remember you made yogurt! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Devon H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product -- the devil is in the hands of the user
customer_reviews.text: Really good. Maker sure you boil the milk in a double boiler, allow it to cool to 110 degrees, add two scoops of whole milk yogurt and stir it well. Set the timer for 6 hours for a store yogurt culture. The yogurt produced is better than any other.
customer_reviews.author: K. Banders

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after 3 uses (in less than a month)
customer_reviews.text: Made 2 great batches of yogurt, 3rd batch the timer stopped 2 hours to go and started ticking with the motor. No button pressing could fix it, nor could unplugging and replugging. 15min wait on the phone, item is now discontinued, so no help from cuisinart. I'll clean out what I have and be returning it to amazon. CRUSHED because this was the ideal yogurt maker.
customer_reviews.author: libbazoid

customer_reviews.title: Love this yogurt maker
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to make yogurt for our dogs as they eat a lot of yogurt. Love it! Took a bit to figure out the right amount of time, but we used it at least 2 times a week since we bought it. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: A little smaller than expected, but great tool!-NEVER MIND!
customer_reviews.text: This keeps my cultures at 100 degrees, which is perfect for what I'm doing. The picture makes it seem like it's a large circular machine, but it's rather narrow, the container can hold 1/4 of a gallon of milk. I love it though.- EDIT Automatic cooling broke within a few days, heats my culture up until it's dead. Waste of money! DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.author: your pen name

customer_reviews.title: No need for preheating/scalding or powdered milk
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing constantly with ultapasteurized milk that I don't preheat and I don't add powdered milk. After I make a batch I just leave about 4 oz of yogurt in the tub and add four cups of cold milk and whisk together. The yogurt comes out great every time. I usually turn it into greek yogurt by straining. Yes, if you're serious about making yogurt this is your best bet. Literally, the only other kitchenware you need is a spoon and a container to store yogurt in the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: AstroMom

customer_reviews.title: It broke after about 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved it....until it broke. As many others have reported, the yogurt suddenly stopped getting thick. (That, by the way, is grosser than it sounds.) I think the heating element may have stopped working properly.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Delaney

customer_reviews.title: I could not be happier with this maker
customer_reviews.text: This is convenient beyond words, and worth every cent. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Kain

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this product
customer_reviews.text: The machine worked well for about two months - then it stopped maintaining the critical 110 degree temperature. After the yogurt failed to set 3 times in a row, I discovered the culture was sitting at room temperature. This appears to be a common problem. I’d avoid this product - especially since their customer service is atrocious.
customer_reviews.author: RCW

customer_reviews.title: Make good yogurt
customer_reviews.text: We have used it for over a year now and it worked very well. Make good yogurt and easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Shea

customer_reviews.title: Good quality construction
customer_reviews.text: Good quality construction, easy to operate. Produces great result and a quantity that will last a week with one serving per day. The timing sequences will require some trial and error, based on the recipe and cultures that you use.
customer_reviews.author: T. Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: - Only makes 4 cups of yougart. - contradicting ...
customer_reviews.text: - Only makes 4 cups of yougart. - contradicting instructions, example: just add ingredients, or heat milk 1st? - plan on at least 16 hrs..
customer_reviews.author: I. W. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Not a wise purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I made two batches and then it ceased operation....it simply makes a clicking noise and doesn’t heat. I am not impressed with this cuisinart device.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Harlow

customer_reviews.title: I did the easy way and didn't heat the milk
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned at first because of the mixed reviews. I think this is very much worth it. The yogurt is beyond tastier than store bought. I did the easy way and didn't heat the milk. It turned out fine. I strained to get nice Greek constancy. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.text: This makes yogurt so easy to make. I have run into problems sometimes with it not turning out, don't know why, but it works way better than the boiling the milk and keeping up with the temperature then cooling it. It does it all for you.
customer_reviews.author: Vessel2

customer_reviews.title: Broken after one year of use
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this yogurt maker. It saved me money on yogurt, and reduced my plastic waste. Unfortunately, after less than one year of use, the heating element has gone bad. I bought a unit with a three year warranty, but as of today Cuisinart no longer makes the product.
customer_reviews.author: Margy

customer_reviews.title: Warranty or lack thereof.
customer_reviews.text: Great when it works. The first one I bought lasted a little over one year before the heating element failed. The second one is still in use. It’s only 60 days old. Hopefully it will last longer than a year because making a warranty claim thru the manufacture or they Amazon is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: ronald e. jennings

customer_reviews.title: doesnt make as much as they claim
customer_reviews.text: I used store bought plain yogurt and farm fresh whole milk I found that as long as I used the store bought yogurt I didn't get near as much edible yogurt as they claim but once I started using my home made yogurt it seemed to make more product I will keep working with it to see what happens
customer_reviews.author: Jane Lee

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful machine
customer_reviews.text: Best $100 splurge. I use it all the time. Makes perfect yogurt using fat free milk and Oikos fat free greek yogurt as starter. No brainer, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: ... have used it now for about 6 months and love it and it works hard for me in producing ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used it now for about 6 months and love it and it works hard for me in producing lots of yogert
customer_reviews.author: Norman D. Van Manen

customer_reviews.title: I love this yogurt maker
customer_reviews.text: I love this yogurt maker. I have used it about 10 times already with perfect results. I am trying different yogurts for starters and 2% Lactaid milk because I am lactose intolerant. When I find one that I really like I will start using my own yogurt as the starter.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda W.

customer_reviews.title: This item stopped working one week after 6 months - Cusinart have not responded
customer_reviews.text: We were using this on a regular basis to make our own yogurt - then one week after 6 months it simply stopped heating the yogurt. The machine has power to it - the hot plate is just not working. We sent an immediate note to Cusinart having got to their site through Amazon - no response! I recommend you find an alternative that will last longer than 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An easy way to make delicious yogurt at home!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love my new yogurt maker!!! I use nonfat yogurt and low-fat milk and the yogurt comes out firm and absolutely perfect weekly!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Beynon

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a few months, then stopped heating/making yogurt.
customer_reviews.text: This yogurt maker worked for several months, and then something happened so it quit heating, which means the yogurt no longer makes yogurt. I was quite disappointed, since this was supposed to be such a high-tech, automatic yogurt maker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quit working
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for a few months. Then it stopped working. After reading another’s review about the “guarantee,” I won’t be attempting to get it fixed. I will look elsewhere for a different yogurt maker. It was too expensive for such a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Literary Classic Fan

customer_reviews.title: I loved the idea it wasn't practical for my day to ...
customer_reviews.text: Too small for my use. This product didn't create enough batches of yogurt for the time and trouble invested. While in theory, I loved the idea it wasn't practical for my day to day needs.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Zotovich

customer_reviews.title: Continuing to locate the right mix and measurements of ingredients to have a good consistency. Though frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I'm limited to using almond milk so preparing yogurt is a bit of a trial. Continuing to locate the right mix and measurements of ingredients to have a good consistency. Though frustrating, it will be rewarding when that time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: love this machine very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: love this machine very easy to use. if you forget about the yogurt and it has finished incubation; the chilling mode is a life saver for a busy mom!!
customer_reviews.author: judith olson

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using a minimally processed farm milk and I'm still getting a very thin yogurt, but I love that it's homemade. I haven't tried heating the milk first. The unit works well and I love that it cools the yogurt too, so no worries about timing!
customer_reviews.author: K. McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Produces pretty good yogurt
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. Wife loves it. Produces pretty good yogurt. Daughter sold some at an university fair and people loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Heriberto Burgos

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT SWITCH TO COOLING. NO REFUND
customer_reviews.text: Does not switch to cooling at the end of fermentation. The whole reason I spent a few extra dollars was for that feature and it doesnt work. And forget about the return policy. Its a joke. Will NEVER use Cuisinart again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I defenitely recommend this machine 👍
customer_reviews.text: I've been making yoghurt for 4 months now average 3 times a month.... No problems with the machine keeping the tempi. And no problem with going to automatic refrigerator mode .... I defenitely recommend this machine 👍.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Came with a 120V plug only...
customer_reviews.text: Broke down the minute I plugged it in. Machine was shipped to Hong Kong with a US plug, 120V. HK is 220V...never been able to use it since, broke 😢
customer_reviews.author: David Roos

customer_reviews.title: Faulty. Never worked
customer_reviews.text: I got it and it would work. I have the the convert from 110/120 to 220/240. I have no issue with any other North American appliances. Must have been a faulty machine. Can’t return it as shipping is too expensive. Waste of money. Shame
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Boil the milk in advance and you will have the thick yogurt in 4 hours
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: getting healthy
customer_reviews.text: Received one of these yogurt makers for Christmas and purchased one for my sister. We both love it. It makes great yogurt and if you want it thick, beat the 6 oz of yogurt with the whisk before you add the milk. Feel very healthy now.
customer_reviews.author: C.  Kenny

product_meta.title: Cuisinart CYM-100 Electronic Yogurt Maker with Automatic Cooling,3.12lb Jar capacity,(1.5L)
product_meta.description:
CUISINART CYM-100 ELECTRONIC YOGURT MAKER WITH AUTOMATIC COOLING
The Cuisinart Electronic Yogurt Maker with Automatic Cooling turns milk and soymilk into nutritious yogurt automatically. Yogurt lovers can create an endless variety of flavors and the 1-1/2 liter batch makes enough for days of delicious meals and snacks. Operation is simple. Once processing time has elapsed, the unit switches itself to a cooling mode.

Today's health-conscious consumers want to eat right. Not only a great source of protein and calcium, yogurt also contains probiotics, or good bacteria, that are crucial for a healthy digestive system. The Cuisinart Electronic Yogurt Maker takes the guesswork out of making yogurt at home. Simply mix together ingredients and pour into the yogurt container, letting the yogurt maker do the rest. You will love the ready-to-eat chilled results.

Either plain or flavored, yogurt is the perfect anytime food to enjoy alone, with granola or in your morning smoothie. Yogurt is also a great ingredient to have on hand in the kitchen for delicious and moist baked goods, as a secret ingredient to marinades for meat and poultry, and also the perfect vehicle for soups and sauces.

PRODUCT BENEFITS
Large Capacity: Make more than six 8-ounce servings of yogurt at a time in the 50-ounce yogurt container.

Automatic Cooling Mode: The unit switches to cooling mode when the processing cycle is done, and maintains temperature until you turn the unit off.

Perfect Results - Automatically: Just add milk or soymilk, active cultures and flavors of your choice; select the time and press START and then watch the CYM-100 do all the work.

Simple Operation: Start and stop your yogurt making at the touch of a button. The LED display clearly displays and counts down processing time. The time controls make it easy to set the recommended processing time for the recipe you're using.

Stainless Steel Styling: Sleek, elegant and streamlined enough to leave right on the counter.

OPERATION INSTRUCTIONS
 1. Put all of the ingredients in the yogurt container and then cover it with the yogurt container lid.
 2. Place the filled container into the housing and cover with the housing lid.
 3. Plug the unit in and the default fermentation time (8 hours) will begin flashing on the screen. To change the fermentation time (1-24 hours), use the "+" and "-" buttons.
 4. Once desired fermentation time is flashing on the LED display, press the START button. At this point, the fermentation numbers on the LED will become solid and fermentation countdown will begin.
 5. After the fermentation is complete the unit will automatically switch into cooling mode and display "C" in the LED. As long as the unit is plugged in, it will stay in cooling mode until you turn the unit off. After 8-12 hours, the temperature of the yogurt will be between 43 and 52 degrees Fahrenheit.
 6. To turn the unit off or end the cooling cycle, press and hold the STOP button for 3 seconds. Once the unit is off, you can either remove the yogurt container and place it directly in the refrigerator, or use the yogurt scoop provided and divide yogurt into individual portions.

TIPS AND HINTS
FINISHED YOGURT AND TASTE
 * 
 * Longer fermentation times will produce a tangier yogurt, but also aid in thickening. Strain yogurt overnight using a strainer lined with a coffee filter, for an ultra-rich and thick treat.
 * Whole milk is recommended for making yogurt -- avoid ultra-pasteurized milk. Fuller-fat milks produce thicker yogurts.
 * When adding a flavor to yogurt, wait until 6 hours after the cooling process has begun. Flavors can also be added to individual portions as needed instead of to the entire batch. Certain flavors may shorten the shelf life of yogurt. Fruit mix-in flavors last longer and are better added to the entire batch, while sweeter syrups are best added to individual portions.
 * Yogurt will be at its best and should be eaten within the first three days after completion. Yogurt can be kept for up to 8 days.
feature_bullets: Built-in cooling system automatically shifts to the perfect chilling temperature
50-ounce yogurt container allows you to make more than six 8-ounce servings of yogurt at once
Easy operation starts and stops yogurt making with the touch of a button
Time controls make it easy to set the recommended fermenting time according to recipe
Stainless steel styling; digital time display; 120 volts. BPA free
NOTE: Refer the User Manual before use.
